title: No keyboard input in TigerVNC(Java) when embedded/integrated in window
author: demirdag
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
I have an SSH session to my linux machine at home. I also forward tcp5900 over my ssh session and connect to VNC on my home-linux machine. Normal operation would be that I can embed the VNC (java) client into mRemoteNG and work with that. 

This all works perfectly except for the fact that I cannot use the keyboard in the embedded VNC session. Everything BUT embedded in mRemoteNG and the keyboard input...

iterations.description: Java AWT/Swing has its own focus model that conflicts with Win32 SetParent embedding — keyboard events aren't forwarded to the embedded TigerVNC Java window because Java intercepts WM_SETFOCUS differently than native apps.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Java AWT/Swing has its own focus model that conflicts with Win32 SetParent embedding — keyboard events aren't forwarded to the embedded TigerVNC Java window because Java intercepts WM_SETFOCUS differently than native apps.
Approach: After SetParent embedding, explicitly call SetFocus/SendMessage(WM_SETFOCUS) on the Java child window handle, and/or install a low-level keyboard hook (WH_KEYBOARD_LL) to relay WM_KEYDOWN/WM_KEYUP to the embedded Java HWND when it is the active connection.
